The Derive Stream as Line tool generates stream line features from an input surface raster with no prior sink or depression filling required.

The elevation raster that will be used for calculation.

The input that defines the locations of real depressions or sinks, where water can flow into but not out of.

For feature inputs, the count depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

The raster layer that defines the fraction of flow that contributes to flow accumulation at each cell.

The threshold for determining whether a given cell is part of a stream in terms of the total area that flows into such a cell.

Specifies whether the stream segments in the output will have a constant value, unique values, or are ordered.

Specifies whether the output stream lines will be smoothed into simpler shapes.

If checked, the stream line features will be simplified using the Douglas-Peucker algorithm with a tolerance of sqrt(0.5) * cell size. This is the default. If unchecked, the stream line features will not be smoothed.

The name of the stream line features layer that will be created and added to the map.

The name of the folder in My content where the results will be saved.
